ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Interactive Reingold-Tilford tree diagrams created using 'D3.js', where every node can be expanded and collapsed by clicking on it. Tooltips and color gradients can be mapped to nodes using a numeric column in the source data frame. See 'collapsibleTree' website for more information and examples.

Interactive Reingold-Tilford tree diagrams created using 'D3.js', where every node can be expanded and collapsed by clicking on it. Tooltips and color gradients can be mapped to nodes using a numeric column in the source data frame. See 'collapsibleTree' website for more information and examples.

name: r-collapsibletree
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.1.8" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-collapsibletree
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/collapsibleTree_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/collapsibleTree/collapsibleTree_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 98c6dccebba9c488a8547bafaea3202e88c189451fd5f8fb6b1dd5c30bafb6c4

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-data.tree
    - r-htmlwidgets
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-data.tree
    - r-htmlwidgets

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('collapsibleTree')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('collapsibleTree')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/AdeelK93/collapsibleTree, https://AdeelK93.github.io/collapsibleTree/
  license: GPL-3.0-or-later
  summary: Interactive Reingold-Tilford tree diagrams created using 'D3.js', where every node can be expanded and collapsed by clicking on it. Tooltips and color gradients can be mapped to nodes using a numeric column in the source data frame. See 'collapsibleTree' website for more information and examples.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file: '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-3'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - halldc
